extends java.lang.Object
    Used to validate types of arguments and the length of the arguments array

    • Method Detail

      • validateArgsLength

        public static boolean validateArgsLength(java.lang.String[] args,
                                         int length)
        Used to validate the number of arguments for commands with multiple arguments, and a certain number of them expected.
        Parameters:
        args - The list of arguments.
        length - The expected length.
        Returns:
        True if non-null values occupy the args array up to length, false if otherwise.

      • softValidatePetName

        public static boolean softValidatePetName(java.lang.String petName)
        Checks if the pet name is a possibility through regex matching
        Parameters:
        petName - The pet name to check
        Returns:
        True if pet name checks out, false otherwise

      • validatePetName

        public static boolean validatePetName(DBWrapper dbw,
                                      java.lang.String ownerUUID,
                                      java.lang.String petName)
        Soft validates pet names and checks that pet name is unique.
        Parameters:
        dbw - The DBWrapper instance for the database connection
        ownerUUID - The pet owner's UUID, used for checking if pet names are unique to them
        petName - The pet name to validate
        Returns:
        True if pet name checks out, false otherwise

      • validateUsername

        public static boolean validateUsername(java.lang.String userName)
        Checks if username COULD be a valid Minecraft name. Does not check if that name is actually in use.
        Parameters:
        userName - The username to check
        Returns:
        True if possible, false if not

      • isForSomeoneElse

        public static java.lang.String isForSomeoneElse(java.lang.String argOne)
        Checks if argOne is of the type f:[username] or from:["username]
        Parameters:
        argOne - The argument to check
        Returns:
        A string representing the username after f:[username], null if argument is not of the type f:[username]/from:[username]
